com.adonax.audiocue

Class AudioMixer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adonax.audiocue.AudioMixer

  • public class AudioMixer
extends java.lang.Object
    AudioMixer combines the output of members of an AudioMixerTrack collection into a single SourceDataLine output line. Classes implementing AudioMixerTrack can be added and removed from the mix asynchronously, with the operation occurring at the next buffer iteration. Source tracks must provide for the return of an array of sound data frames whose length is specified by the AudioMixer. Unlike an analog mixer used in sound studios, the AudioMixer does not provide functions such as panning or volume controls. The only standard function is an equivalent of a mute control, accessible via the running variable. The mixer imposes a simple floor/ceiling of -1, 1, to guard against volume overflows.
    Version:
    AudioCue 1.1
    Author:
    Philip Freihofner
    See Also:
    http://adonax.com/AudioMixerTrack, http://adonax.com/AudioCue

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioMixer

        public AudioMixer()
        Constructor for AudioMixer, using default settings: Mixer = system default Buffer size = 8196 frames Thread priority = 10. The buffer size pertains to the frames collected in a single while loop iteration. A buffer that corresponds to the same number of frames converted to bytes is assigned to the SourceDataLine.

      • AudioMixer

        public AudioMixer(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer mixer,
                  int bufferSize,
                  int threadPriority)
        Constructor for AudioMixer. The buffer size is the number of frames collected in a single while loop iteration. A buffer with a corresponding frame count, calculated in bytes, is assigned to the SourceDataLine. A thread priority of 10 is recommended, in order to help prevent sound drop outs. Note that a well designed and properly running sound thread should spend the vast majority of its time in a blocked state, and thus have a minimal impact in terms of usurping cpu cycles from other threads.
        Parameters:
        mixer - javax.sound.sampled.Mixer to be used
        bufferSize - int specifying the number of frames to process with each iteration
        threadPriority - int ranging from 1 to 10 specifying the priority of the sound thread

    • Method Detail

      • getTrackLength

        public int getTrackLength()
        Returns the number of tracks being mixed.
        Returns:
        integer number of tracks being mixed.

      • addTrack

        public void addTrack(AudioMixerTrack track)
        Designates an AudioMixerTrack to be staged for loading to the array of tracks being mixed. If the mixer is not running, the track will become part of the mix when the (@code AudioMixer} is started. If the AudioMixer is running, the method updateTracks must be executed in order for the new track to be added to the mix.
        Parameters:
        track - AudioMixerTrack to be added

      • removeTrack

        public void removeTrack(AudioMixerTrack track)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException
        Designates an AudioMixerTrack to be staged for removal from the array of tracks being mixed. If the mixer is not running, the track, if previously added, will not be included in the mix when the (@code AudioMixer} is started. If the AudioMixer is running, the method updateTracks must be executed in order for the new track to be removed from the mix.
        Parameters:
        track -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException

      • updateTracks

        public void updateTracks()
        This method signals the AudioMixer's playback loop to update the collection of tracks being mixed at the next opportunity (depends on the size of the buffer). Tracks to be added or removed are staged for update by the methods addTrack and removeTrack.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Starts the operation of the AudioMixer. A running AudioMixer iteratively sums a buffer's worth of frames of sound data from a collection of AudioMixerTracks, and writes the resulting array to a SourceDataLine.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is thrown if the AudioMixer is already running.
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - is thrown if there is a problem securing a SourceDataLine

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Stops the iteration of the AudioMixer after the soonest data write operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the AudioMixer is already in a stopped state.
